name: St. David Lewis

locations.description: Jesuit priest martyred in Usk, Wales

summary: David Lewis was a Welsh Jesuit priest and martyr who was executed during the reign of Charles II. He was ordained in Rome and returned to Wales to minister secretly to Catholics. He was known as 'Father of the Poor' for his charity work. He was arrested, tried, and executed at Usk. He is one of the Forty Martyrs of England and Wales and is the last Welsh martyr. He is remembered for his dedication to serving the poor and his faithfulness to the end.
